interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Midsomer Murders Series 9 Reissue
Review Date: 2016/06/29
Store: John Nettles  (Actor),     Peter Smith  (Director),     Renny Rye  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, TV
Product Description: ['"Now in original U.K. broadcast order “Superbly acted and filmed” —', 'British Heritage', 'magazine Welcome to England’s most murderous county. . . The English village mystery gets a contemporary spin in this hit British television series that has earned a worldwide following. Bucolic settings harbor macabre crimes and eccentric characters that are no match for nice-guy detective Tom Barnaby (John Nettles,', 'Bergerac', ') and his new assistant, Detective Constable Ben Jones (Jason Hughes,', 'This Life', '). “Delightful in a murderously charming way” (Leonard Maltin’s', 'Movie Crazy', '). Guest stars include Simon Callow, George Baker, Siân Phillips, Elizabeth Spriggs, Julia McKenzie, and Peter Capaldi. THE MYSTERIES (original U.K. broadcast order)', 'The House in the Woods', '—A young couple dies on a property that’s rumored to be haunted.', 'Dead Letters', '—The mother of a former festival queen drowns herself during Oak Apple Week. But is it really suicide?', 'Vixen’s Run', '—A thrice-married baronet keels over dead, leaving an estate worth killing for.', 'Down Among the Dead Men', '—An accountant’s slaying leads Barnaby and Jones on a trail of blackmail.', 'Four Funerals and a Wedding', '—An age-old battle of the sexes turns deadly at the Skimmington Fayre.', 'Country Matters', '—A mysterious man turns up murdered on the proposed site of a contentious new supermarket.', 'Death in Chorus', '—The tenor of Midsomer Worthy’s choir is killed prior to a big competition.', 'Last Year’s Model', '—Barnaby has second thoughts about a woman’s guilt as she goes on trial for murder. Now with SDH subtitles Mysteries previously released in Sets 11 and 12.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television/British Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Holthouse, John Nettles, Renny Rye, Sarah Hellings, Peter Smith', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '28930507', 'Director': 'Peter Smith, Renny Rye, Sarah Hellings, Richard Holthouse', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Run time': '13 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2014', 'Actors': 'John Nettles', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: Great Series
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0

Sherlock: The Abominable Bride [DVD]
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Benedict Cumberbatch (The Imitation Game) and Martin Freeman (The Hobbit) return as Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson in the acclaimed modern retelling of Arthur Conan Doyle’s classic stories. But what if this wasn’t the modern day? What if it was the late Victorian period? What if the world’s most famous consulting detective and his best friend lived in a Baker Street of steam trains, hansom cabs, top hats and frock-coats? Welcome to Sherlock in 1895!', 'Bonus Content:', '• Mark Gatiss: A Study in Sherlock – 30-minute “making of” documentary • Mark Gatiss: Production Diary • Creating the Look – Eight inside looks into how different scenes were created in the Sherlock Special • Interview with the writers Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss • Sherlockology Q&A', ']]>']

Midsomer Murders, Series 7 (Reissue)
John Nettles  (Actor),     John Hopkins  (Actor),     Sarah Hellings  (Director),     Peter Smith  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Mystery & Thrillers
['“TV gold” —', 'Entertainment Today', 'Welcome to England’s most murderous county. . .  The English village mystery gets a contemporary spin in this hit British television series that has earned a worldwide following. Bucolic settings harbor macabre crimes and eccentric characters that are no match for nice-guy detective Tom Barnaby (John Nettles,', 'Bergerac', ') and his new assistant, Sergeant Dan Scott (John Hopkins,', 'Love in a Cold Climate', '). “Delightful in a murderously charming way” (', 'Leonard Maltin’s Movie Crazy', '). Guest stars include Henry Ian Cusick, Jim Carter, Stella Gonet, Freddie Jones, Cherie Lunghi, and Henry Cavill.  THE MYSTERIES (original U.K. broadcast order)', 'The Green Man', '—Troy passes his inspector’s exam and has one last case with Barnaby.', 'Bad Tidings', '—Barnaby’s new partner gets a baptism by fire with a case implicating Cully’s old schoolmates.', 'The Fisher King', '—A maze of Celtic rites masks a murderer.', 'Sins of Commission', '—The detectives discover a hotbed of corruption within a highbrow literary crowd.', 'The Maid in Splendour', '—A local pub figures in a case involving secret business deals and unrequited love.  Now with SDH subtitles.  Mysteries previously released in Sets 7 and 8.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** Continues to embrace Comedy and Romantic Comedies, while showcasing a significant interest in Mystery and Thrillers, particularly those that offer unique storytelling. The user remains open to exploring dramas beyond mainstream titles, reflecting a diverse cinematic taste.
  
- **Actor and Director Favorability:** Retains a strong preference for series featuring established actors and skilled directors, indicating a consistent appreciation for high-quality performances and narratives. The user's recent engagement with well-regarded TV series reinforces this trend.

- **Content Rating:** While favoring family-friendly titles rated PG-13, the user demonstrates an increasing openness to unrated content, showcasing a willingness to investigate a broader range of cinematic offerings.

- **Format Preference:** A steadfast preference for physical media, particularly DVDs, aligns with a dedication to collecting films and series. The user continues to seek out highly rated and critically acclaimed content.

- **Overall Sentiment:** Maintains a positive outlook on enjoyable films, applying a discerning eye to narrative and production quality. Recent feedback indicates a particular fondness for engaging series with compelling storytelling and characters.

- **Engagement Style:** Engages through thoughtful, concise reviews and ratings, showcasing a critical yet enthusiastic approach. The user expresses appreciation for well-crafted content while maintaining high standards for entertainment.
